ol.li: In a medium bowl, combine peppers, panko, breadcrumbs, garlic and salmon.
In a small bowl, combine egg, soy sauce, lemon zest, parsley, salt & pepper.
Add to pepper mixture tossing gently to combine.
Form mixture into 8 patties.
Lightly coat a grill or skillet with cooking spray.
Using medium-high heat, add the patties and cook approximately 5 minutes per side.
Heat 2-tablespoon oil in large saucepan.
Sauté the mushrooms, onions and garlic over low heat for 3 minutes, or until soft.
In large bowl, add mushroom mixture, oats, parmesan, breadcrumbs, egg, parsley, oregano, salt and pepper, mix well.
Shape mixture into patties.
Heat 2 oil in large skillet over medium heat.
Sauté patties, cooking about 4 minutes on each side – or until golden brown.
Pre-heat over to 350 degrees.
Using a small knife, cut a slit lengthwise down one side of each poblano pepper.
Make a small crosswise slit along the top to create a T-shape, try not to cut off the top.
Scoop out the seeds, core and ribs using your thumb or a small spoon.

Using tongs, roast each poblano pepper over an open flame, such as a grill or gas stovetop. (Pepper’s can also be tossed through a tablespoon of oil, place onto a baking sheet, cut side down and roasted in the oven at 450 degrees until blackened.)
Roast until the skin is completely blistered and blackened. Transfer to a glass bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let steam for 10-15 min.
Meanwhile, using a food processor, add the jalapeño, tomatoes, onion, garlic, cumin, paprika, salt & pepper, along with 1/4 cup of water. Bend until smooth.
In a large nonstick skillet, over medium heat, add the canola oil.
Add the tomato mixture to the skillet and simmer, until slightly thick.
Pour the tomato mixture into the bottom of a 9x13-baking dish.
Return skillet back over the heat and follow the directions for the filling below.
Add another tablespoon of oil to the skillet; add the onion, garlic and cilantro, sauté 1 minute.
Add the chicken, beans, broth, cumin, garlic powder, coriander, salt & pepper.
Add the chicken, beans, broth, cumin, garlic powder, coriander, salt & pepper.
Use a table knife, scrape off the charred skins of the poblano peppers.
Carefully stuff each pepper with the filling.
Place each pepper in the casserole dish and top with the shredded cheese.
Cover with foil and bake for 20-30 minutes.
Garnish with cilantro.
Combine the ground beef, all but 3 tablespoons of the parsley, green onion, salt, and pepper. Shape mixture into 4 oval patties.
Place 2 tablespoons of flour into a dish and dredge each patty through the flour.
Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the patties and sauté until browned on each side.
Remove patties from the pan to a plate.
Add onions to the pan and sauté 5 minutes.
Stir in the garlic and tomato paste, sauté until paste begins to brown, about 1 min.
Sprinkle the remaining flour over the paste. Cook 1 minute. Stir in broth, wine, and thyme.
Return patties to the pan and bring sauce to a boil.
Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover pan and simmer for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, add bread to a baking sheet. Butter each piece and lightly sprinkle with garlic powder, a pinch of paprika and half the parmesan cheese. Bake until bread is crisp.
To serve, place the toast on a plate, the patty onto the toast, ladle the onion sauce over the top. Finish with the rest of the parmesan cheese and remaining parsley.
